statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -6 \\ -10 \\ 10 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 12 \\ 12 \\ -16 \\ 8 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -20 \\ -33 \\ -27 \\ 41 \\ -34 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -6 \\ -10 \\ 10 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 12 \\ 12 \\ -16 \\ 8 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -20 \\ -33 \\ -27 \\ 41 \\ -34 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
